text: So in this video we will see what is subquery Actually subquery is a very important topic in SQL It will help you a lot in data analytics And the query you write in SQL It helps a lot in making it dynamic So we will see that in the coming video And in this video we will see how is the syntax of subquery How do you use it with where clause in SQL And how you can use different operators in it So let's see what is subquery So if we talk about subquery in basic level So the output of any query you write If you run a query on that output Then we call it subquery And you call this subquery as inner query and nested query So if you see its basic definition A subquery allows us to create complex query on the output of another query And its syntax basically has more than 2 select statements So you can see the syntax below Select column name or column names from table name After that you will write where clause And then column name Whichever column you want to put subquery Column name and then you use the operator After that you write subquery in the bracket And the syntax of subquery is also the same as the basic SQL syntax It is just in the bracket So that's why we call it inner query or subquery So let's consider an example to understand it better So in this example you can see The question is So you can see the table on the right side So it has customer id, amount, mode and payment date So I have these 4 columns So here they need the details of the customers Whose amount is more than average amount from the total amount paid So to make this question easy We will break it into two parts So you can see below, the first part is You have to find the average value of this total amount column And the second part is Once you get the average value Then we will filter the customer data So let's go to SQL and run it So here we are in SQL So first of all we will see the table Which is the input data Select everything from payment table Let's run it So you can see the data we just saw Customer id, amount, mode and payment date The first part was Find the average value So what can I do for that I will write here select Average And the column of which I have to find the average So I have to do the amount Let's run it So now you can see the output My average value is 164 The second part of the question The first part is done, the second part was Filter the customer data Which is greater than the average value So what can I do for that I will call it basic, select For now I will say select everything From payment table And here I will use the where
